body_html:
@asimshankar Thank you for your explanation.

Actually, i don't know the number of columns in the input at the first time. What i hope is record_defaults do not has to match with the number of columns in the input.

If the size of record_defaults is greater than the number of columns, fill in output with the defaults.

If the size of record_defaults is less than the number of columns, throw exception to show that column is missing and required.

Perhaps that is more reasonable, isn't it? :)

body:
@asimshankar Thank you for your explanation. 

Actually, i don't know the number of columns in the input at the first time. What i hope is `record_defaults` do not has to match with the number of columns in the input.

If the size of `record_defaults` is greater than the number of columns, fill in output with the defaults.

If the size of `record_defaults` is less than the number of columns, throw exception to show that column is missing and required.

Perhaps that is more reasonable, isn't it?  :)
